title: 108_hr507
content: TRANSFER OF LANDS INTO TRUST FOR PUEBLOS OF SAN ILDEFONSO AND SANTA CLARA, NEW MEXICO. The United States holds lands in trust for the Pueblo of Santa Clara, including approximately 2,484 acres in Rio Arriba County, New Mexico. This land includes rights to minerals and is under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Land Management. The United States holds lands in trust for the Pueblo of Santa Clara, including approximately 2,484 acres in Rio Arriba County, New Mexico. This land includes rights to minerals and is under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Land Management. The land consists of various sections in Township 20 North, Range 7-8 East, New Mexico Principal Meridian, with specific exceptions for certain tracts owned by San Ildefonso Pueblo. The United States holds lands in trust for the Pueblo of San Ildefonso, including approximately 2,000 acres of land not included in specific grants. All rights and interests in these lands, including minerals, are held by the United States in trust for the Pueblo of San Ildefonso. The Bureau of Land Management of the Department of the Interior manages approximately 2,000 acres of land in Rio Arriba and Santa Fe Counties, New Mexico. This land includes specific portions of Sections 22, 26, and 27 in Township 20 North, Range 7 East, New Mexico Principal Meridian. The land managed by the Bureau of Land Management in Rio Arriba and Santa Fe Counties, New Mexico includes specific portions of Section 34 and part of Section 35 in Township 20 North, Range 7 East, New Mexico Principal Meridian. SEC. 2. SURVEY OF BOUNDARY LINE; PUBLICATION OF DESCRIPTION IN FEDERAL REGISTER. (a) Survey of Boundary Line.--The Secretary of Interior will conduct a survey to establish the boundary lines for the lands held in trust for the Pueblo of Santa Clara and the Pueblo of San Ildefonso, as described in the Agreement to Affirm Boundary Between the two Pueblos. The survey will be conducted by the Office of Cadastral Survey of the Bureau of Land Management within 180 days of the enactment of this Act. Upon completion of the survey, the Secretary will publish the metes and bounds descriptions of the established boundary lines for the lands held in trust for the Pueblo of Santa Clara and the Pueblo of San Ildefonso in the Federal Register. Any technical errors in the legal descriptions will be corrected to ensure consistency with the Agreement. Upon enactment of this Act, lands in sections 1(b) and 1(d) are declared part of Pueblo of Santa Clara's and Pueblo of San Ildefonso's reservations respectively. All lands in Section 1 will be administered according to US laws for property held in trust for Indian tribes. Valid existing rights are preserved. SEC. 4 of the Act preserves valid existing rights, including rights-of-way, leases, permits, mining claims, grazing permits, water rights, and other interests on trust lands. No enlargement, impairment, or effect on existing rights or claims of Pueblos based on Aboriginal or Indian title. SEC. 5 pertains to lands subject to Section 17 of the Pueblo Lands Act. SEC. 5 states that lands owned by Santa Clara and San Ildefonso Pueblos are subject to the Pueblo Lands Act. SEC. 6 specifies that the conveyed land can only be used for traditional purposes or conservation for the benefit of the Pueblos. SEC. 7 addresses water usage. SEC. 7 clarifies that the Act does not reserve water rights for the conveyed land or affect existing water rights of Pueblo of San Ildefonso or Pueblo Santa Clara.
